YqMz5LI8S0ttr0HtPxnLxA.text: Wonderful fresh interesting food combining Mediterranean and Turkish flavor in unique dishes.  Try everything....gyros, salads, Turkish pizzas, spinach and feta pizza and humos and kepaps.  Enjoy this fresh food!

lXLO5TG-humcWDOAMgfPxw.text: Sure... not everything on the menu is done well. And, sometimes there are consistency issues. But, one word... lahmajun. It's a very thin pizza crust topped with a delicious Turkish meat sauce. That's it. You get two 4 slice crusts (8 slices total) in one approximately $10 order and I crave it. The hummus is quite delicious too. And, the 2 gyros and fries deal is cheaper than any other pizza shops around. Consistency is not always on the side of absolutely delicious with the gyros. But, the lahmajun will keep me coming back again and again. Their cheesy bread sticks are also quite good. Terrible for you. But, good. Give Ephesus a try :)

O2FjJ_LtogTPbkJbO9A_sg.text: This place used to be awesome. I don't know if they're under new management lately or what, but the last couple experiences were not good. Their regular pizza tastes like bad grade school cafeteria pizza. Their white pizza is soggy, greasy, undercooked and the veggies are wilted, sloppy and pathetic, nowhere near as fresh as they once were. The time I got chicken carbonara, it tasted like someone poured hot 2% milk over noodles- runny and flavorless. The only thing that saves this place are their breakfast pizzas. They are pretty sweet. But considering the last 3+ times I've ordered, the wait has been over an hour and a half, not even breakfast pizza will bring me back. Oh, and their one delivery guy is SUPER creepy to girls with tattoos.

PGVToKqytJAGte7tgBIzfg.text: Update: after having tried Ephesus a couple more times, I have to say that I am a fan, and it's now my go-to spot for pizza. Their pies are pretty good, but what really won me over was their wings (they're called "wing dings" on the menu). They are crisp on the outside, yet juicy and succulent on the inside. They don't skimp on the sauce and there is plenty extra to dip my crust in. Usually when you order wings from a pizza place around here, they'll arrive soggy and congealed. At Ephesus the wings are not fatty and are well cooked.  I haven't tried one of their moroccan pizzas but that is next on the list. The last time I had food delivered from there, I did not think it took too long, but it was the owner who brought it and he said that I should order by phone rather than online and it will be quicker. So I guess it must take some time for the grubhub orders to go through or be acknowledged.

lLtvAU_0wqrLDJl59Z8b_A.text: Had the gyro salad and fettuccine  alfredo delivered. Both portions were huge.  The pasta also came with garlic bread and side salad. Everything was delicious. I didn't think it was expensive for the amount of food we got. Everyone was polite. I will be ordering again.

BowVQnw0F9P0jOqoeVgESg.text: This was my second time ordering in from this Ephesus because I keep getting their ad in my mailbox and I'm really impressed. The first time we ordered we just got a regular pizza and we were surprised to get a really delicious pizza delivered to our door within 30 minutes.  This time we went for something unique and ordered the gyro special with fries and also the Pide with Soujcuk and egg (Turkish pizza). We both absolutely loved both items. I was surprised to get such a delicious gyro from a take out joint and the Turkish pizza was great for something different!  Will definitely order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States. The gyro!

7lGP2GIqeihb95h0v3n60Q.text: First, let me preface this by saying. If you order from here, only get the pizza (the salads are inedible).   If you are getting it delivered, they make mistakes extremely often and the owner will argue with you over the phone to the point that by the time you eat your food, it is ice cold.   I have never had an owner argue and attack me verbally over the phone for ten minutes, it is truly a first. Not too mention when they put cheese on my pizza, after I expressly said no cheese six times, I cannot physically consume it, and after the owner have argued with me, it had been over an hour and a half since I had placed my order.   You'd be better off ordering pizza at Taco Bell.

q0NRxOlEIqKTqMGU9tubhA.text: The popcorn chicken is not chicken. It is small 'popcorn sized' pieces of friend breading.  Literally if the over 200 or so pieces (that's how small) maybe 15 had chicken in them. We were super dissapointed in this but the two specialty piZzas were good. Bbq Hawaiian and gyro.  Great for pizza not for popcorn 'chicken' wink wink

AyFS1gyhpEjpyp9peRbj1g.text: Delivery is always at least 20 minutes late and they never include the requested condiments. Food is okay but not good enough to warrant such a hassle.

1xHgF0R8pbReIGgks64HWg.text: Some of the best food we've ever had. You get SO MUCH food for what you pay! I got kebabs and my husband got a sub. Both deliciously amazing.   We will say, the delivery time was very long. Although we were warned ahead of time when we ordered. About an hour and a half. But so worth the wait.  We will definitely get food from them again!

pOhMB79-c0BZWgcTQnuVWA.text: delicious pizza.. terrible customer service! tried ordering for delivery (yes, it's winter and yes.. it's Pittsburgh!) they asked if we lived on a hill or a flat street. after my mother said we live on a hill, the girl who answered the phone placed us on hold. then a man came on the phone, spoke so softly we could hardly hear him. he asked what we wanted. went through the whole order. just for him to say "the weather is very bad out" and wouldn't deliver.

YTmhlc-Gj0ypNGJYhQ7oiA.text: I recently ordered a three topping pizza and a gyro platter. The best French fries around. I was shocked to see that they weren't shoestring or limp & soggy "fresh cut" fries. They were hot,  crispy, and not overly salty. The gyro was just ok, the pita was a little over done.  The pizza was great, I especially liked the sauce they used. It was nice to see mushrooms not from a can. One issue was I thought the toppings are a little pricey.  I will probably eat here on a regular basis.

8ArPjiuK01pRRfA4j-9GZg.text: Stopped in to get a gyro.  Friendly service and somehow related to the location on 4th downtown.  The menu has some variety from Wraps & Gyro's to Pide (Turkish Pizza) to kebaps, to regular pizza, salads and wings.    My gyro was good.  The fries were pretty good too.  Will have to stop back and try a Pide.  The person next to us had a Pide and said it was his favorite thing on the menu.

smTVWtbSAVmn7SgqmazJMg.text: I ordered takeout from Ephesus through GrubHub on 4/9/2015. The order was for a large pizza, a fried calzone and buffalo fries. The order was placed at 7 pm. I received the traditional e-mail from GrubHub stating that my order was in the works and would be delivered between 8:15 and 8:25 pm. This was not a problem.  8:35 rolled around and my food had still not been delivered. I called the store to find out where my food was. The young girl on the phone simply said that they were backed up because of the GrubHub orders, and that was it, no apology. I asked if my food was on its way and gave her my address. She told me it was. 25 minutes later, at 9 pm, my food finally arrived lukewarm, with no apology made as to how late it was.  The food itself was good, but the customer service was severely lacking. A simple phone call to let us know our food would be 35 minutes lat would have sufficed. Even an apology would have been better than the treatment we received.  I'm not sure if this shop is new to GrubHub, but I feel that they should have been better prepared for the influx of orders that using the system would cause.

SfdmuFpYoVe62ChMcnLU8g.text: I have ordered from Ephesus several times in the past, have enjoyed their pizza, but was shocked by the terrible service and rude treatment we received last evening. We placed an online order at 7:24 p.m. We live ten minutes from Aspinwall where they are located. Delivery eta was 45 minutes. At 20 minutes past the expected delivery, I called to check status. They said our pizza was on the way. Another 20 minutes later I called. They said they'd call the driver. Fifteen minutes later I called and they said they'd call the driver again. I asked the woman her name and told her to refund my money. Silence. I asked her for her name again. She hung up! Ten minutes later the cold pizza arrived. Unacceptable. Such a disappointment! A simple, "We are sorry. It's a busy night" would've sufficed. Not from these folks. Business 101: don't piss off your customers. They'll tell everyone they know. This is a disreputable business that we will never order from again.

00AZMtQfcnFurZh_xj0ZEw.text: This is the cheesiest,most delicious, gooey wonderful pizza I've had in a long time. After trying all the pizza joints A-wall has to offer, I think I have found my go-to. We also got some expertly-done wings. Not dry, not soggy, just enough crispyness.   Their menu also includes some really delicious-looking specialty pizzas I can't wait to try.

4dMyHBY3hcS3eZTicXWFCg.text: I've only been here once but plan to go back soon. They are conveniently located on the edge of Aspinwall and they have a fairly comprehensive menu for a pizza joint.   My group tried the chorizo and fontilla pizza and it was mind-numbingly good. The crust was robust yet soft and doughy and the toppings were unexpected yet so well curated. None of us like olives, which come with that pizza, but we forgot to ask for them to be left off and the flavors of the pizza worked so well together that we all enjoyed the olives! That really says something!   The staff was friendly and laid back. We had ordered over the phone and mentioned a coupon which we forgot to take along at pick up. No one cared and we still received our free cheesy bread sticks, which are really a generous sized pizza sans sauce, which we all loved. The grape leaves were a bit dry but still preferable to the overly saturated ones you find in cans or at the Greek olive bars in grocery stores. An order of grape leaves also meant complimentary garlic bread. This place does not skimp on carbs!   Check out their menu and coupons. You're bound to find a flavor styling and deal that works for you!

2EGwV6mEs2OHev1cOqIj-w.text: Really good food. I like the pides and the buffalo chicken pizza is delicious.  The only problem is their delivery is pretty bad. I've done delivery 3 times, and it was only on time once. Aim for a 1h15m wait if you're ordering.

oAAVzdTDmxEVJ4mUXYAlAg.text: Absolutely amazing.... The lamb kabob pizza was awesome, the wings were good,perfectly cooked, and there was no beating the homemade hummas. This is a place i will frequent, unique and tasty...

QdYlGNWC4C7HjwPvCreLCQ.text: Awesome selection of interesting pies. Had pizza delivered to my office and everyone was blown away with their pizzas of choice. I will definitely order from them again when I am feeling adventurous and looking to step away from the normal pizza.

MK0lF5ZvvniKkhaI1yJuMA.text: I found this place downtown and now one closer to home. Good quality and nice people!

BAETh6iWB0Lnik5_04JIyw.text: Greasy, bland and lacking flavor.  I have ordered some dishes here that tasted awful while others were your typical food at a dive pizza place.  Think frozen then deep-fried, canned sauce with no spices, frozen pierogies from Restaurant Depot swimming in fake butter sauce etc.

o6Eovgso5aFkXV6ILnntdQ.text: I just got my pizza from Ephesus  for the 4th time and it's still of good quality.  I ordered from the the one in Aspinwall,. They are always friendly on the phone and the same when it's delivered,  The pizza is delicious. I am pretty much just an onion and green pepper, and sometimes cheddar cheese kind of guy, and the sauce and crust is awesome. I can only imagine how good those specialty pizzas are,

O8rspkTYuAYCa3pg-whxHQ.text: crooks they overcharge you on grubhub with increase price. stay away don't try these crooks. food is terrible so is customer service. there are better restaurants in pittsburgh. this is piss poor excuse for a turkish restaurant.

JzkQ4kJpTKpbj6mdie1vQw.text: We'd have never chosen this place had it not been one of the only places still open after 11 o'clock. So glad we did!  All of the food was great. My three-year-old and I split a white personal pizza with artichokes, feta, and sun dried tomatoes. It was delicious and plenty of food for both of us! We also had a traditional pizza and pirogies which were also good.  Prices were decent but more than you might spend elsewhere. The only bummer was that we were hoping for delivery, but they didn't have any drivers at the time. Other than that, it was a nice surprise!

DtszieO9pzu1Jog9HOI1mg.text: Food is always solid here. BBQ Hawaiian is delicious! And the boneless garlic wings. The Moroccan pizza is also quite good. Delivery seems longer than most and sometimes I have to call which is why I'm giving 4 rather than 5 stars.

CUiL_KJMmwW45-Ga0SjRjA.text: Before last night, I likely would have given Ephasus a 4 star review. However, the most recent experience I had left A LOT to be desired.  We ordered a white pizza and the hummus platter (hummus, veggies, pita). Pizza was great - cooked perfectly and tasted yummy. The hummus platter...the hummus has always been delicious and last night was no different. However, the veggies that they sent were disgusting and old. The carrots were *actually slimy." Gross.  Knowing that we were the last order of the night (because they seriously called me like "hey, um, since you're paying on a card, we need to know the tip amount so we can close the store" - I tipped in cash), I decided to wait until today to call, and I *specifically* waited until after lunch rush (1:00pm+). After explaining to the manager (or owner...I don't know...it was a lady with a thick accent) what happened, and asking for a refund or a note to credit our account, she was just silent. I'm like "Hello are you there?" She says "Yes, why you didn't call last night??!!" So I'm like "Are you f****** joking right now? THAT's your response!?" I told here that I decided to wait because I knew we were the last delivery. She was VERY short with me, in fact rude and unprofessional, and responded "OK, I'll give you refund."  The last thing I said - before the bitch hung up on me - was "You know, you could really use a lesson in customer service. I truly hope that you are not the owner, because if this is how you're running your business, you most definitely won't be around for much longer.

_MedW4Bxbbw3OXcx9vS2NQ.text: Decided to get lunch out with some co-workers so we ordered delivery from Ephesus. Delivery time was reasonable as was the price for everything. The buffalo chicken pizza was pretty good with the spicy fries and cheesy goodness. The ranch to dip it in was yummy as well. The chicken tasted okay but didn't look fresh. It tasted like it was processed or frozen beforehand. The best part hands down were the fries on top! Overall, two personal pizzas were enough to feed three very hungry people with some left over. I'd order from here again but next time I'd go in to see if the dine-in experience is a little better.

photos.caption: Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Pizza
Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States

jmgDm49TmDgRQjZ0gJhacw.text: This particular location is inconsistent at getting customer orders correct.  Based on three recent takeout experiences, two were not what they should've been for my wife and I.  The food quality by itself is decent, but you never know if the order is right unless you take the time to check every item before driving out of their parking lot.

IqALF-UxAzoIlQTYZHDHVQ.text: WORST HOAGIES EVER. I ordered a tuna sub and there was practically no tuna on it and it looked as if it came out of a can . Not even albacore chunks, the cheap shredded kind. The cheeseburger sub was just a dry hamburger patty. No mayo . No cheese . Welted lettuce . Not warm .   We waited 45 mins for delivery just to be disappointed.  Don't waste your money here . Whoever rated them 4.5/5 on Grubhub is clearly faking reviews.

DtfyM99aFbTJcq1QERcELw.text: Ordered from here because of all the good reviews. Ordered Chicken Kabob pizza and received lamb. Called and was told to call again and they would give me it free next time. I'm traveling and definitely won't order from here tomorrow. Doesn't help with dinner tonight!

Ipl1JSuM1a82cbOS6nEHLA.text: Ewww....just got lunch delivered from this joint and I'm utterly disappointed...the lettuce was brown and mushy I almost choked to death on the butt end of an iceberg lettuce! The fries were soggy and bland! The chicken sandwich had a gummy consistency like it was either old or not Cooked properly! If I could give no stars I would...also they served some strange off brand ketchup!!! That's a big no no in the burg! I'm considering calling for a refund!!!! I give credit where credit is due but ergh!!!! So many better options! Update: contacted grub hub and let them know about the order and I actually found my sandwich was raw! The restaurant absolutely refused to reimburse any of my money and was unwilling to work with the Grubhub customer service rep! Guess they will take anything they will get and really do not care about customer service! Crap food crap service!

photos.caption: Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States
Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States
Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States

lmG4jnaq5R4ryRBG6VLnzQ.text: Ephesus has some of my favorite pizza, but the delivery service is atrocious.  If you order online make sure that you tip in cash.  Otherwise they will leave the pizza at the door without even a phone call.  Just happened to me and I had to call them before they admitted that they left it at our front desk an hour ago.  Delivery times are also wildly unpredictable ranging anywhere from 30 minutes to 2 hours.  Avoid this place unless can afford the time and hassle.

MugtHUXY_JUE6HffbGKBMw.text: The customer service is kind of terrible. Like, be prepared to just stand in the lobby listening to people talk in the back ignoring your. They forgot sauce with my order which is always kind of annoying.   The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either. Their buffalo fries are seriously sub par compared to other pizza places in the area.   I didn't have their actual pizza though, so I may be back with an updated review.

h06aIBBTRcJDGkbOQKQFIg.text: I ordered from Ephesus on GrubHub. Pittsburgh had one of the worst storms I have ever seen and on my way to the restaurant a tree feel two cars ahead of me and my car was being swept away by the rushing water on the street. After about 45 mins of trying to get to the restaurant, I called to explain I would not be able to pick up my food that I ordered since my car could not get through the 1+ feet of water. After some back and forth the restaurant agreed to cancel my order even though it was already made. Instead of doing so, they lied to get me off the phone and said they would cancel the order, but instead charged me anyway. I can not order from a restaurant that lies to itz customers. Please be aware when ordering from Ephesus.

tBMMspNa27eJ8qbzouv0IQ.text: In mid November seven of us ordered a variety of dishes delivered on a Saturday afternoon. I got the garden salad and tabouleh, and the others got burgers and pizza. They had no complaints about their food but mine was awful. The salad was at best medium sized and had little more than iceberg lettuce, some tomatoes and a minute amount of cucumber. It was warm from being in the bag with the hot food. The tabouleh was the worst I've ever had. The parsley was old and tough, and there was virtually nothing else in it, just small traces of bulgur wheat, no visible tomatoes, cucumber, lemon flavor or anything else you expect in tabouleh.  I couldn't eat it and put it in the fridge, thinking maybe I'd eat it later. The next day the lettuce was brown so I threw it all out. Since one of the other people placed the order, I wasn't aware of the prices and when I saw that the salad had cost $11.99 and the tabouleh $7.68, I couldn't believe I had paid about $20 for inedible food. I called on Monday and was told to call back when the manager was there. I got her the next day, complained and told her I wanted a refund for the two items. She took my information and agreed with no apology. My credit card wasn't credited after several days, so I called again on November 29. She made a hard to understand excuse about us using different banks, and took my info again. She promised to call back the next day, and I never heard from her. Obviously, she has no intention of honoring her promises and couldn't care less about correcting the bad order. I'll never order from there again.

y7HkvwLTv3PUvQrFmg7yGA.text: If you're in the market for a buttload of carbs, look no further. This is a good local pizza shop! They have a huge menu with a lot of unique pizza offerings, many with a Mediterranean influence (for example, Morrocan chicken and spiced plum pizza, which is surprisingly tasty). They also have the standard make-your-own pizza toppings and the usual specialty pizza suspects (white pizza, buffalo chicken pizza). In general, they make a solid pie. Their crust is slightly sweet and more on the doughy than crispy side (which I happen to prefer). Their red pizza sauce is also slightly sweet, but well-balanced with acidity from the tomatoes and well seasoned. And, importantly, they don't skimp on the cheese or on the toppings, which is appreciated.  What I like even more than the pizza, however, are their non-pizza apps and meals. For example, their boneless wings are surprisingly delicious for being made at a pizza shop. They're large and meaty with a nice crunchy coating and doused in your choice of sauce (I'm a fan of the honey BBQ sauce). I also like their pasta dishes -- they make a really good chicken parm pasta dinner (which, again, I did not expect at a pizza joint). I'd also recommend their subs -- they are generous with the fillings, and the bread they use is really hearty and chewy. They also offer several Turkish specialties (Pide (Turkish pizza), kabobs, babaganoush, etc.). I've not sampled many of these, but I look forward to working my way through that part of the menu soon!  Overall, I think it's great that there is such a huge variety of items that you can order from this one shop. Prices are fairly reasonable too -- just be sure to grab one of their menu flyers (or look online) and don't order anything before checking our their deals. They offer TONS of coupons and specials, so take the time to check out their flyer to make sure you don't miss a chance to save money!

photos.caption: Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States. Chicken parm pasta dinner (family size)
Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken pizza
Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States. Chicken and broccoli calzone

eOv-Nxs23bhyNJTSM2fSuA.text: Delicious gyro and the stuffed grape leaves were excellent. The people that worked there were very friendly and super kind. It was clean and inviting . A great lunch spot.

pdEaaLvnQ4cuf_5EAcfTJg.text: I tried the hummus, felafel, and grape leaves, and it was mostly excellent, except that the grape leaves did not seem home made.  The staff is very friendly and the service is quick.   The dining room is just 4 tables, but most of their businesses is take-out.

VaLoXJLJYDFeBVoKLjQv7w.text: Decided to give this place a shot because they are so close to where I live. On 420 I ordered a veggie personal pizza with white sauce for my beautiful girlfriend and I ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni mushroom onion for myself. I go to pick it up and the lady working acted like she had no idea where my order was and then she gave me two personal pizzas (mess up #1) she said she will make my medium pizza and to give her 10 min so I wait, she eventually comes out with a medium pizza I take it to my car open the box and there is no pepperoni on the pizza (mess up #2) I go back in to tell the lady that there is no pepperoni and she tells me that I never ordered pepperoni so I take my phone out and show her my online order and all she says is 5 minutes. We finally make it back home to eat the pizza and my girlfriends pizza is made with red sauce when we ordered it with white sauce (mess up #3) My pizza was not even edible, the was pizza was not even cut and the whole pie was absolutely drenched in grease. It was like trying to eat a pizza that sank to a bottom of a swimming pool. Will not be returning, very frustrated with how much money I wasted on this establishment.

5iScr4A9vl-R_aTlEXb5LQ.text: In my boyfriend's words, "How could you even make a pizza that bad? Did an earthquake happen and make all the toppings fall off the shelf onto the pizza? It looks like the salad bar just threw up on the pizza."  Delivery took over an hour, but worse is the fact that the pizza was completely smothered in nearly raw onion, peppers, mushrooms, and sausage. I am more tolerant of raw onions than many people, but undercooked sausage is just plain gross. And of course the crust was totally soggy, so picking up a slice just made half the toppings fall on the plate anyway. Won't be trying this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States. A mountain of nearly raw toppings. Yuck

wr2oBXLevyJU7ldfufa7PQ.text: Found these guys on eat24, the delivery driver called to let me know he was close, really nice touch. The food was prompt and really good. They have killer sausage and I have had a couple hoagies, all fantastic.

a5KvNxUxlpnoUR95et_cKQ.text: Best place for gourmet pizza and middle eastern delivery. I'm not allowed to leave my station at work and I frequently forget breakfast and then crash at 10am, turning into a potentially homicidal maniac. I also have a sensitive stomach so the vending machine is not my friend. I order the vegetable breakfast pizza from Ephesus and it's always fresh and perfect, with grilled vegetables and no burnt or mushy bits. My other favorite is an asparagus pizza with a gluten-free crust. My carnivorous coworker likes their large steak hoagies because you are getting actual steak, and not re-heated "soup meat". The salads are pretty good, too. Most pizza places just sell boxed salads, but even their salads are fresh.

4CBRr9rvZcHsTxRFSZZvlA.text: DELICIOUS. Seriously, the best pizza I've ever had so far and completely unexpected! I had friends tell me their pizza was good, but I didn't imagine it was this good.   I had to have the buffalo chicken pizza and boy am I glad I did! The toppings are LOADED on... The chicken is moist and there are fried potato slices. The cheese is so good and the crust is crisp on the outside, yet so soft on the inside. Excellent! We've also ordered the lamb and chicken kebab pizza that come with individual generous kebabs on top of the pizza!  The hummus is to die for and the pita bread makes it even better! So soft and completely addicting. My only recommendation is to order more bread than what comes with the hummus!  I work in the area, so we've had our orders delivered and they always arrive before the expected time, which is great! I love that they offer personal size pizzas, which are an extremely generous portion and well worth every penny. I highly recommend Ephesus!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ephesus Mediterranean Kitchen - Aspinwall, PA, United States. Personal Buffalo Chicken Pizza

CVaZgHnPS0gPBOUnjMcxUg.text: So, a co-worker of mine said that she had a taste for "pide" and would I like to join her for lunch.  To myself, "Um, what the heck is "pide"?  However, I told her, "Yes, that sounds pretty good".  So down the street and around the corner and into a building tucked away on Fourth Street, Downtown, we go!  After giving the secret handshake and being sworn to silence, we enter what looks like a vacant space and order "pide" (Turkish pizza).  OMG!  Who knew that anything like Turkish pizza existed?  It was so tasty!  Pide does not look like pizza; Shaped like a flat football with pinched ends and filled with eggs, cheese and spinach, it was unusual but wonderful.  My co-worker, who frequently eats vegetarian meals turned me on to this and I couldn't thank her enough. Since the pide was so tasty, I decided to try one of the Ephesus gourmet pizzas with kebabs.  You can order either chicken or lamb kebobs and I ordered half of each on my pizza.  I thought that they would slice the kebab meat and stick on the pizza, but no!  Each slice has its own kebab!  Yippee Skippee!  The best way to eat it is to hold the skewer inside the slice and then wrap the pizza slice around the kebab meat.  Mmmm Mmmm Good!  Ephesus' Downtown Pittsburgh location has since moved closer to PPG Plaza and more easily accessible, which is a good thing.  They also now have a location in Aspinwall which is closer to my home and boy am I glad.  I took a friend visiting from out of town there and he ordered the Moroccan Spiced Chicken and Dried Plum pizza.  I would have never associated those ingredients with pizza, but they were tasty too!  Don't go there looking for fawning service or an elaborate atmosphere...It's not that place.  However, if you want to try delicious pizza with unusual toppings and an excellent crust, this is your place!
